name: Checking Your Drag
description: Drag is your line’s resistance to force. Learn how to check, adjust, and trust it — so your line yields before it breaks.
steps: Before casting, pull your line to feel resistance — it should give slightly.
For light line or small fish, use light drag to prevent breakage.
For big fish or heavy cover, tighten drag but still allow give.
Adjust during fight if needed — reel and listen.
Check frequently — especially when changing gear or bait.
commonMistakes: Too-tight drag leads to snapped lines.
Never checking drag until it’s too late.
journalPrompt: Do you tend to hold on too tightly or let go too easily? What’s your drag set to in life?
tairoGuidance: The line must yield before it breaks — like the heart in patience.
whisper: Drag is not weakness — it is wisdom in motion.
